text:
Two questions:
• Does anyone know a Julia package for point processes? Is there a need for one?
• Is there a Julia package more general than `Distributions.jl`, in which the sample can have an arbitrary type?
Context: I’m trying to apply HMMs with point process emissions. I recoded some point processes and the Baum-Welch algorithm, but I would like to make my code available. I like the concept behind <https://github.com/maxmouchet/HMMBase.jl>, which contains distribution-independent inference and learning algorithms. Only problem is: `Distributions.jl`  only supports reals or arrays as sample types, and the observations in my case are point process histories

<@U81PB6N77> indeed I would be interested in contributing to `MeasureTheory.jl`, I followed your posts from afar and - although I don’t fully understand how the library works - it sounds like a great idea!

My representation of a point process realization is based on temporal point processes:
```struct History{T}
    dates::Vector{Float64}
    marks::Vector{T}
end```
I would be interested in discussing the adaptation to spatial point processes, especially since the ordering of “dates” would fall apart
